you need to enable masquerading: I set that in the proftpd.conf...but it shows 127.0.0.1 instead of the internal ip
127.0.0.1 is your internal ip, its not going to show your 192 or other private ip unless thats what you setup as your masquerading address
but what saying is the ip that goes to his machine is a 192.whatever address...and he needs the 192.whatever to point to his public ip
i understand what you're saying, but thats not what you want. its correct for proftpd to say 127.0.0.1 masquerading as xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx
then why will it still not connect
as long as that xxx ip is the one your public ip is, you're good.
have you forwarded port 21 on your local router?
you might also check to ensure your isp does not block port 21, many do
